mdRecord.dcterms:title: A voyage to North-America: undertaken by command of the present king of France. Containing the geographical description and natural history of Canada and Louisiana. With the customs, manners, trade and religion of the inhabitants / By Father Charlevoix. Also, a description and natural history of the islands in the West Indies belonging to the different powers of Europe
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Charlevoix, Pierre-François-Xavier de, 1682-1761
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Printed for J. Exshaw, and J. Potts
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 2 v. fronts (1 port.), 8 fold maps. 20 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A reprint of "Letters to the dutchess of Lesdiguières," edition of 1763, with the Preliminary discourse and letter I, supplied from "Journal of a voyage to North-America," edition of 1761.
Translation of v. 3: Histoire et description général de la nouvelle France, avec le journal historique d'un voyage ... dans l'Amérique Septentrionale.--Rich v. 1, p. 77.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Tracy W. McGregor Library, American History Collection. Bookplate of Geo. Cavendish.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Indians of North America
Canada--Description and travel.
Mississippi River Valley--Description and travel.
New France--Discovery and exploration.
West Indies--Description and travel.
